intro: Pseudodiphryllum chorisianum, commonly known as the false diphryllum, is a rare and unusual plant belonging to the family Lardizabalaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a single, spirally twisted stem that resembles a helix. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are alternate and simple, often with a distinctive waxy coating. This species is primarily found in specific regions of China and is of interest to botanists due to its peculiar structure and limited distribution.
